388#ifndef CL_HPP_
389#define CL_HPP_
390
391/* Handle deprecated preprocessor definitions. In each case, we only check for
392 * the old name if the new name is not defined, so that user code can define
393 * both and hence work with either version of the bindings.
394 */
395#if !defined(CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP) && defined(USE_DX_INTEROP)
396# pragma message("opencl.hpp: USE_DX_INTEROP is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP instead")
397# define CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP
398#endif
399#if !defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION) && defined(USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION)
400# pragma message("opencl.hpp: USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION instead")
401# define CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION
402#endif
403#if !defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS) && defined(__CL_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
404# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __CL_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS instead")
405# define CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
406#endif
407#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR) && defined(__NO_STD_VECTOR)
408# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __NO_STD_VECTOR is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR instead")
409# define CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR
410#endif
411#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING) && defined(__NO_STD_STRING)
412# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __NO_STD_STRING is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING instead")
413# define CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING
414#endif
415#if defined(VECTOR_CLASS)
416# pragma message("opencl.hpp: VECTOR_CLASS is deprecated. Alias cl::vector instead")
417#endif
418#if defined(STRING_CLASS)
419# pragma message("opencl.hpp: STRING_CLASS is deprecated. Alias cl::string instead.")
420#endif
421#if !defined(CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS) && defined(__CL_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS)
422# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __CL_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS is deprecated. Define CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS instead")
423# define CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS
424#endif
425
426/* Warn about features that are no longer supported
427 */
428#if defined(__USE_DEV_VECTOR)
429# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __USE_DEV_VECTOR is no longer supported. Expect compilation errors")
430#endif
431#if defined(__USE_DEV_STRING)
432# pragma message("opencl.hpp: __USE_DEV_STRING is no longer supported. Expect compilation errors")
433#endif
434
435/* Detect which version to target */
436#if !defined(CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION)
437# pragma message("opencl.hpp: CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is not defined. It will default to 300 (OpenCL 3.0)")
438# define CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION 300
439#endif
440#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 100 && \
441 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 110 && \
442 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 120 && \
443 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 200 && \
444 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 210 && \
445 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 220 && \
446 CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION != 300
447# pragma message("opencl.hpp: CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is not a valid value (100, 110, 120, 200, 210, 220 or 300). It will be set to 300 (OpenCL 3.0).")
448# undef CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
449# define CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION 300
450#endif
451
452/* Forward target OpenCL version to C headers if necessary */
453#if defined(CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION)
454/* Warn if prior definition of CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is lower than
455 * requested C++ bindings version */
456#if CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
457# pragma message("CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION is already defined as is lower than CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION")
458#endif
459#else
460# define CL_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
461#endif
462
463#if !defined(CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION)
464# define CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION 200
465#endif
466#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 100 && \
467 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 110 && \
468 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 120 && \
469 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 200 && \
470 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 210 && \
471 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 220 && \
472 CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION != 300
473# pragma message("opencl.hpp: CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION is not a valid value (100, 110, 120, 200, 210, 220 or 300). It will be set to 100")
474# undef CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION
475# define CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION 100
476#endif
477#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION > CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION
478# error "CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION must not be greater than CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION"
479#endif
480
481#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 100 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_0_APIS)
482# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_0_APIS
483#endif
484#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 110 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
485# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS
486#endif
487#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 120 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_2_APIS)
488# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_2_APIS
489#endif
490#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 200 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_0_APIS)
491# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_0_APIS
492#endif
493#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 210 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_1_APIS)
494# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_1_APIS
495#endif
496#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION <= 220 && !defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_2_APIS)
497# define CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_2_2_APIS
498#endif
499
500#ifdef _WIN32
501
502#include <malloc.h>
503
504#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP)
505#include <CL/cl_d3d10.h>
506#include <CL/cl_dx9_media_sharing.h>
507#endif
508#endif // _WIN32
509
510#if defined(_MSC_VER)
511#include <intrin.h>
512#endif // _MSC_VER
513
514 // Check for a valid C++ version
515
516// Need to do both tests here because for some reason __cplusplus is not
517// updated in visual studio
518#if (!defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus < 201103L) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER < 1700)
519#error Visual studio 2013 or another C++11-supporting compiler required
520#endif
521
522//
523#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION) || defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_SUB_GROUPS_KHR)
524#include <CL/cl_ext.h>
525#endif
526
527#if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__MACOSX)
528#include <OpenCL/opencl.h>
529#else
530#include <CL/opencl.h>
531#endif // !__APPLE__
532
533#if (__cplusplus >= 201103L || _MSVC_LANG >= 201103L )
534#define CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ noexcept
535#else
536#define CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
537#endif
538
539#if __cplusplus >= 201703L
540# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ inline
541#elif defined(_MSC_VER)
542# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ __declspec(selectany)
543#elif defined(__MINGW32__)
544# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ __attribute__((selectany))
545#else
546# define CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ __attribute__((weak))
547#endif // !_MSC_VER
548
549// Define deprecated prefixes and suffixes to ensure compilation
550// in case they are not pre-defined
551#if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
552#define CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
553#endif // #if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
554#if !defined(CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
555#define CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED
556#endif // #if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED)
557
558#if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
559#define CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED
560#endif // #if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
561#if !defined(CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
562#define CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED
563#endif // #if !defined(CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_2_DEPRECATED)
564
565#if !defined(CL_CALLBACK)
566#define CL_CALLBACK
567#endif //CL_CALLBACK

570#include <limits>
571#include <iterator>
572#include <mutex>

576
577// Define a size_type to represent a correctly resolved size_t
578#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
579namespace cl {
580 using size_type = ::size_t;
581} // namespace cl
582#else // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
583namespace cl {
584 using size_type = size_t;
585} // namespace cl
586#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
587
588
589#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
590#include <exception>
591#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
592
593#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR)
594#include <vector>
595namespace cl {
596 template < class T, class Alloc = std::allocator<T> >
597 using vector = std::vector<T, Alloc>;
598} // namespace cl
599#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_VECTOR)
600
601#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING)
602#include <string>
603namespace cl {
604 using string = std::string;
605} // namespace cl
606#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_STRING)
607
608#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
609
610#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_UNIQUE_PTR)
611#include <memory>
612namespace cl {
613 // Replace unique_ptr and allocate_pointer for internal use
614 // to allow user to replace them
615 template<class T, class D>
616 using pointer = std::unique_ptr<T, D>;
617} // namespace cl
618#endif
619#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
620#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_ARRAY)
621#include <array>
622namespace cl {
623 template < class T, size_type N >
624 using array = std::array<T, N>;
625} // namespace cl
626#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_ARRAY)
627
628// Define size_type appropriately to allow backward-compatibility
629// use of the old size_t interface class
630#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
631namespace cl {
632 namespace compatibility {
637 template <int N>
638 class size_t
639 {
640 private:
641 size_type data_[N];
642
643 public:
645 size_t()
646 {
647 for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
648 data_[i] = 0;
649 }
650 }
651
652 size_t(const array<size_type, N> &rhs)
653 {
654 for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
655 data_[i] = rhs[i];
656 }
657 }
658
659 size_type& operator[](int index)
660 {
661 return data_[index];
662 }
663
664 const size_type& operator[](int index) const
665 {
666 return data_[index];
667 }
668
670 operator size_type* () { return data_; }
671
673 operator const size_type* () const { return data_; }
674
675 operator array<size_type, N>() const
676 {
677 array<size_type, N> ret;
678
679 for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
680 ret[i] = data_[i];
681 }
682 return ret;
683 }
684 };
685 } // namespace compatibility
686
687 template<int N>
688 using size_t = compatibility::size_t<N>;
689} // namespace cl
690#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_SIZE_T_COMPATIBILITY)
691
692// Helper alias to avoid confusing the macros
693namespace cl {
694 namespace detail {
695 using size_t_array = array<size_type, 3>;
696 } // namespace detail
697} // namespace cl
698
699
705namespace cl {
706 class Memory;
707
708#define CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(name) \
709 if (!pfn_##name) { \
710 pfn_##name = (PFN_##name) \
711 clGetExtensionFunctionAddress(#name); \
712 if (!pfn_##name) { \
713 } \
714 }
715
716#define CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(platform, name) \
717 if (!pfn_##name) { \
718 pfn_##name = (PFN_##name) \
719 clGetExtensionFunctionAddressForPlatform(platform, #name); \
720 if (!pfn_##name) { \
721 } \
722 }
723
724 class Program;
725 class Device;
726 class Context;
727 class CommandQueue;
728 class DeviceCommandQueue;
729 class Memory;
730 class Buffer;
731 class Pipe;
732
733#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
738 class Error : public std::exception
739 {
740 private:
741 cl_int err_;
742 const char * errStr_;
743 public:
753 Error(cl_int err, const char * errStr = NULL) : err_(err), errStr_(errStr)
754 {}
755
756 ~Error() throw() {}
757
762 virtual const char * what() const throw ()
763 {
764 if (errStr_ == NULL) {
765 return "empty";
766 }
767 else {
768 return errStr_;
769 }
770 }
771
776 cl_int err(void) const { return err_; }
777 };
778#define CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(x) #x
779#else
780#define CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(x) NULL
781#endif // CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
782
783
784namespace detail
785{
786#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
787static inline cl_int errHandler (
788 cl_int err,
789 const char * errStr = NULL)
790{
791 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
792 throw Error(err, errStr);
793 }
794 return err;
795}
796#else
797static inline cl_int errHandler (cl_int err, const char * errStr = NULL)
798{
799 (void) errStr; // suppress unused variable warning
800 return err;
801}
802#endif // CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS
803}
804

809#define __GET_DEVICE_INFO_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clGetDeviceInfo)

940#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
941#define __ENQUEUE_MARKER_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clEnqueueMarker)
942#define __ENQUEUE_WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clEnqueueWaitForEvents)
943#define __ENQUEUE_BARRIER_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clEnqueueBarrier)
944#define __UNLOAD_COMPILER_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clUnloadCompiler)
945#define __CREATE_GL_TEXTURE_2D_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateFromGLTexture2D)
946#define __CREATE_GL_TEXTURE_3D_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateFromGLTexture3D)
947#define __CREATE_IMAGE2D_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateImage2D)
948#define __CREATE_IMAGE3D_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateImage3D)
949#endif // #if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
950
954#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_2_APIS)
955#define __CREATE_COMMAND_QUEUE_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateCommandQueue)
956#define __ENQUEUE_TASK_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clEnqueueTask)
957#define __CREATE_SAMPLER_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCreateSampler)
958#endif // #if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
959
963#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
964#define __ENQUEUE_MARKER_WAIT_LIST_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clEnqueueMarkerWithWaitList)
965#define __ENQUEUE_BARRIER_WAIT_LIST_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clEnqueueBarrierWithWaitList)
966#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
967
968#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
969#define __CLONE_KERNEL_ERR CL_HPP_ERR_STR_(clCloneKernel)
970#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
971
972#endif // CL_HPP_USER_OVERRIDE_ERROR_STRINGS
974
975
976namespace detail {
977
978// Generic getInfoHelper. The final parameter is used to guide overload
979// resolution: the actual parameter passed is an int, which makes this
980// a worse conversion sequence than a specialization that declares the
981// parameter as an int.
982template<typename Functor, typename T>
983inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Functor f, cl_uint name, T* param, long)
984{
985 return f(name, sizeof(T), param, NULL);
986}
987
988// Specialized for getInfo<CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES>
989// Assumes that the output vector was correctly resized on the way in
990template <typename Func>
991inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, vector<vector<unsigned char>>* param, int)
992{
993 if (name != CL_PROGRAM_BINARIES) {
994 return CL_INVALID_VALUE;
995 }
996 if (param) {
997 // Create array of pointers, calculate total size and pass pointer array in
998 size_type numBinaries = param->size();
999 vector<unsigned char*> binariesPointers(numBinaries);
1000
1001 for (size_type i = 0; i < numBinaries; ++i)
1002 {
1003 binariesPointers[i] = (*param)[i].data();
1004 }
1005
1006 cl_int err = f(name, numBinaries * sizeof(unsigned char*), binariesPointers.data(), NULL);
1007
1008 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1009 return err;
1010 }
1011 }
1012
1013
1014 return CL_SUCCESS;
1015}
1016
1017// Specialized getInfoHelper for vector params
1018template <typename Func, typename T>
1019inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, vector<T>* param, long)
1020{
1021 size_type required;
1022 cl_int err = f(name, 0, NULL, &required);
1023 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1024 return err;
1025 }
1026 const size_type elements = required / sizeof(T);
1027
1028 // Temporary to avoid changing param on an error
1029 vector<T> localData(elements);
1030 err = f(name, required, localData.data(), NULL);
1031 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1032 return err;
1033 }
1034 if (param) {
1035 *param = std::move(localData);
1036 }
1037
1038 return CL_SUCCESS;
1039}
1040
1041/* Specialization for reference-counted types. This depends on the
1042 * existence of Wrapper<T>::cl_type, and none of the other types having the
1043 * cl_type member. Note that simplify specifying the parameter as Wrapper<T>
1044 * does not work, because when using a derived type (e.g. Context) the generic
1045 * template will provide a better match.
1046 */
1047template <typename Func, typename T>
1048inline cl_int getInfoHelper(
1049 Func f, cl_uint name, vector<T>* param, int, typename T::cl_type = 0)
1050{
1051 size_type required;
1052 cl_int err = f(name, 0, NULL, &required);
1053 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1054 return err;
1055 }
1056
1057 const size_type elements = required / sizeof(typename T::cl_type);
1058
1059 vector<typename T::cl_type> value(elements);
1060 err = f(name, required, value.data(), NULL);
1061 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1062 return err;
1063 }
1064
1065 if (param) {
1066 // Assign to convert CL type to T for each element
1067 param->resize(elements);
1068
1069 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
1070 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
1071 for (size_type i = 0; i < elements; i++) {
1072 (*param)[i] = T(value[i], true);
1073 }
1074 }
1075 return CL_SUCCESS;
1076}
1077
1078// Specialized GetInfoHelper for string params
1079template <typename Func>
1080inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, string* param, long)
1081{
1082 size_type required;
1083 cl_int err = f(name, 0, NULL, &required);
1084 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1085 return err;
1086 }
1087
1088 // std::string has a constant data member
1089 // a char vector does not
1090 if (required > 0) {
1091 vector<char> value(required);
1092 err = f(name, required, value.data(), NULL);
1093 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1094 return err;
1095 }
1096 if (param) {
1097 param->assign(begin(value), prev(end(value)));
1098 }
1099 }
1100 else if (param) {
1101 param->assign("");
1102 }
1103 return CL_SUCCESS;
1104}
1105
1106// Specialized GetInfoHelper for clsize_t params
1107template <typename Func, size_type N>
1108inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, array<size_type, N>* param, long)
1109{
1110 size_type required;
1111 cl_int err = f(name, 0, NULL, &required);
1112 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1113 return err;
1114 }
1115
1116 size_type elements = required / sizeof(size_type);
1117 vector<size_type> value(elements, 0);
1118
1119 err = f(name, required, value.data(), NULL);
1120 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1121 return err;
1122 }
1123
1124 // Bound the copy with N to prevent overruns
1125 // if passed N > than the amount copied
1126 if (elements > N) {
1127 elements = N;
1128 }
1129 for (size_type i = 0; i < elements; ++i) {
1130 (*param)[i] = value[i];
1131 }
1132
1133 return CL_SUCCESS;
1134}
1135
1136template<typename T> struct ReferenceHandler;
1137
1138/* Specialization for reference-counted types. This depends on the
1139 * existence of Wrapper<T>::cl_type, and none of the other types having the
1140 * cl_type member. Note that simplify specifying the parameter as Wrapper<T>
1141 * does not work, because when using a derived type (e.g. Context) the generic
1142 * template will provide a better match.
1143 */
1144template<typename Func, typename T>
1145inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func f, cl_uint name, T* param, int, typename T::cl_type = 0)
1146{
1147 typename T::cl_type value;
1148 cl_int err = f(name, sizeof(value), &value, NULL);
1149 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1150 return err;
1151 }
1152 *param = value;
1153 if (value != NULL)
1154 {
1155 err = param->retain();
1156 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
1157 return err;
1158 }
1159 }
1160 return CL_SUCCESS;
1161}

1365#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_1_(F) \
1366 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_HOST_TIMER_RESOLUTION, size_type) \
1367 F(cl_program_info, CL_PROGRAM_IL, cl::vector<unsigned char>) \
1368 F(cl_kernel_info, CL_KERNEL_MAX_NUM_SUB_GROUPS, size_type) \
1369 F(cl_kernel_info, CL_KERNEL_COMPILE_NUM_SUB_GROUPS, size_type) \
1370 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_MAX_NUM_SUB_GROUPS, cl_uint) \
1371 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_IL_VERSION, string) \
1372 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_SUB_GROUP_INDEPENDENT_FORWARD_PROGRESS, cl_bool) \
1373 F(cl_command_queue_info, CL_QUEUE_DEVICE_DEFAULT, cl::DeviceCommandQueue) \
1374 F(cl_kernel_sub_group_info, CL_KERNEL_MAX_SUB_GROUP_SIZE_FOR_NDRANGE, size_type) \
1375 F(cl_kernel_sub_group_info, CL_KERNEL_SUB_GROUP_COUNT_FOR_NDRANGE, size_type) \
1376 F(cl_kernel_sub_group_info, CL_KERNEL_LOCAL_SIZE_FOR_SUB_GROUP_COUNT, cl::detail::size_t_array)
1377
1378#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_2_(F) \
1379 F(cl_program_info, CL_PROGRAM_SCOPE_GLOBAL_CTORS_PRESENT, cl_bool) \
1380 F(cl_program_info, CL_PROGRAM_SCOPE_GLOBAL_DTORS_PRESENT, cl_bool)
1381
1382#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_DEVICE_FISSION_(F) \
1383 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PARENT_DEVICE_EXT, cl_device_id) \
1384 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_TYPES_EXT, cl::vector<cl_device_partition_property_ext>) \
1385 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_AFFINITY_DOMAINS_EXT, cl::vector<cl_device_partition_property_ext>) \
1386 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_REFERENCE_COUNT_EXT , cl_uint) \
1387 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_STYLE_EXT, cl::vector<cl_device_partition_property_ext>)
1388
1389#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_CL_KHR_EXTENDED_VERSIONING_CL3_SHARED_(F) \
1390 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_NUMERIC_VERSION_KHR, cl_version_khr) \
1391 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_EXTENSIONS_WITH_VERSION_KHR, cl::vector<cl_name_version_khr>) \
1392 \
1393 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_NUMERIC_VERSION_KHR, cl_version_khr) \
1394 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS_WITH_VERSION_KHR, cl::vector<cl_name_version_khr>) \
1395 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_ILS_WITH_VERSION_KHR, cl::vector<cl_name_version_khr>) \
1396 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_BUILT_IN_KERNELS_WITH_VERSION_KHR, cl::vector<cl_name_version_khr>)
1397
1398#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_CL_KHR_EXTENDED_VERSIONING_KHRONLY_(F) \
1399 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_OPENCL_C_NUMERIC_VERSION_KHR, cl_version_khr)
1400
1401#define CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_3_0_(F) \
1402 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_NUMERIC_VERSION, cl_version) \
1403 F(cl_platform_info, CL_PLATFORM_EXTENSIONS_WITH_VERSION, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1404 \
1405 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_NUMERIC_VERSION, cl_version) \
1406 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS_WITH_VERSION, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1407 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_ILS_WITH_VERSION, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1408 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_BUILT_IN_KERNELS_WITH_VERSION, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1409 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_ATOMIC_MEMORY_CAPABILITIES, cl_device_atomic_capabilities) \
1410 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_ATOMIC_FENCE_CAPABILITIES, cl_device_atomic_capabilities) \
1411 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_NON_UNIFORM_WORK_GROUP_SUPPORT, cl_bool) \
1412 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_OPENCL_C_ALL_VERSIONS, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1413 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_WORK_GROUP_SIZE_MULTIPLE, size_type) \
1414 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_WORK_GROUP_COLLECTIVE_FUNCTIONS_SUPPORT, cl_bool) \
1415 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_GENERIC_ADDRESS_SPACE_SUPPORT, cl_bool) \
1416 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_OPENCL_C_FEATURES, cl::vector<cl_name_version>) \
1417 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_DEVICE_ENQUEUE_CAPABILITIES, cl_device_device_enqueue_capabilities) \
1418 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_PIPE_SUPPORT, cl_bool) \
1419 F(cl_device_info, CL_DEVICE_LATEST_CONFORMANCE_VERSION_PASSED, string) \
1420 \
1421 F(cl_command_queue_info, CL_QUEUE_PROPERTIES_ARRAY, cl::vector<cl_queue_properties>) \
1422 F(cl_mem_info, CL_MEM_PROPERTIES, cl::vector<cl_mem_properties>) \
1423 F(cl_pipe_info, CL_PIPE_PROPERTIES, cl::vector<cl_pipe_properties>) \
1424 F(cl_sampler_info, CL_SAMPLER_PROPERTIES, cl::vector<cl_sampler_properties>)
1425
1426template <typename enum_type, cl_int Name>
1427struct param_traits {};
1428
1429#define CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_(token, param_name, T) \
1430struct token; \
1431template<> \
1432struct param_traits<detail:: token,param_name> \
1433{ \
1434 enum { value = param_name }; \
1435 typedef T param_type; \
1436};
1437
1438CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1439#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
1440CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_1_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1441#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
1442#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1443CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_2_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1444#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1445#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
1446CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1447#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
1448#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
1449CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_1_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1450#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
1451#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 220
1452CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_2_2_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1453#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 220
1454#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 300
1455CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_3_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1456#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 300
1457
1458#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_SUB_GROUPS_KHR) && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < 210
1459CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_SUBGROUP_KHR_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1460#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_SUB_GROUPS_KHR) && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < 210
1461
1462#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_IL_KHR)
1463CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_IL_KHR_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1464#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_USE_IL_KHR)

1475 F(cl_image_info, CL_IMAGE_BUFFER, cl::Buffer)

1477// Include deprecated query flags based on versions
1478// Only include deprecated 1.0 flags if 2.0 not active as there is an enum clash
1479#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION > 100 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200 && CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
1480CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_0_DEPRECATED_IN_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1481#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 110
1482#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION > 110 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200

1484#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1485#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION > 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200
1486CL_HPP_PARAM_NAME_INFO_1_2_DEPRECATED_IN_2_0_(CL_HPP_DECLARE_PARAM_TRAITS_)
1487#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 200

1489#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION)

1491#endif // CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION

1576
1577// Convenience functions
1578
1579template <typename Func, typename T>
1580inline cl_int
1581getInfo(Func f, cl_uint name, T* param)
1582{
1583 return getInfoHelper(f, name, param, 0);
1584}
1585
1586template <typename Func, typename Arg0>
1587struct GetInfoFunctor0
1588{
1589 Func f_; const Arg0& arg0_;
1590 cl_int operator ()(
1591 cl_uint param, size_type size, void* value, size_type* size_ret)
1592 { return f_(arg0_, param, size, value, size_ret); }
1593};
1594
1595template <typename Func, typename Arg0, typename Arg1>
1596struct GetInfoFunctor1
1597{
1598 Func f_; const Arg0& arg0_; const Arg1& arg1_;
1599 cl_int operator ()(
1600 cl_uint param, size_type size, void* value, size_type* size_ret)
1601 { return f_(arg0_, arg1_, param, size, value, size_ret); }
1602};
1603
1604template <typename Func, typename Arg0, typename T>
1605inline cl_int
1606getInfo(Func f, const Arg0& arg0, cl_uint name, T* param)
1607{
1608 GetInfoFunctor0<Func, Arg0> f0 = { f, arg0 };
1609 return getInfoHelper(f0, name, param, 0);
1610}
1611
1612template <typename Func, typename Arg0, typename Arg1, typename T>
1613inline cl_int
1614getInfo(Func f, const Arg0& arg0, const Arg1& arg1, cl_uint name, T* param)
1615{
1616 GetInfoFunctor1<Func, Arg0, Arg1> f0 = { f, arg0, arg1 };
1617 return getInfoHelper(f0, name, param, 0);
1618}
1619
1620
1621template<typename T>
1622struct ReferenceHandler
1623{ };
1624
1625#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1629template <>
1630struct ReferenceHandler<cl_device_id>
1631{
1641 static cl_int retain(cl_device_id device)
1642 { return ::clRetainDevice(device); }
1652 static cl_int release(cl_device_id device)
1653 { return ::clReleaseDevice(device); }
1654};
1655#else // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1659template <>
1660struct ReferenceHandler<cl_device_id>
1661{
1662 // cl_device_id does not have retain().
1663 static cl_int retain(cl_device_id)
1664 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1665 // cl_device_id does not have release().
1666 static cl_int release(cl_device_id)
1667 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1668};
1669#endif // ! (CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120)
1670
1671template <>
1672struct ReferenceHandler<cl_platform_id>
1673{
1674 // cl_platform_id does not have retain().
1675 static cl_int retain(cl_platform_id)
1676 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1677 // cl_platform_id does not have release().
1678 static cl_int release(cl_platform_id)
1679 { return CL_SUCCESS; }
1680};
1681
1682template <>
1683struct ReferenceHandler<cl_context>
1684{
1685 static cl_int retain(cl_context context)
1686 { return ::clRetainContext(context); }
1687 static cl_int release(cl_context context)
1688 { return ::clReleaseContext(context); }
1689};
1690
1691template <>
1692struct ReferenceHandler<cl_command_queue>
1693{
1694 static cl_int retain(cl_command_queue queue)
1695 { return ::clRetainCommandQueue(queue); }
1696 static cl_int release(cl_command_queue queue)
1697 { return ::clReleaseCommandQueue(queue); }
1698};
1699
1700template <>
1701struct ReferenceHandler<cl_mem>
1702{
1703 static cl_int retain(cl_mem memory)
1704 { return ::clRetainMemObject(memory); }
1705 static cl_int release(cl_mem memory)
1706 { return ::clReleaseMemObject(memory); }
1707};
1708
1709template <>
1710struct ReferenceHandler<cl_sampler>
1711{
1712 static cl_int retain(cl_sampler sampler)
1713 { return ::clRetainSampler(sampler); }
1714 static cl_int release(cl_sampler sampler)
1715 { return ::clReleaseSampler(sampler); }
1716};
1717
1718template <>
1719struct ReferenceHandler<cl_program>
1720{
1721 static cl_int retain(cl_program program)
1722 { return ::clRetainProgram(program); }
1723 static cl_int release(cl_program program)
1724 { return ::clReleaseProgram(program); }
1725};
1726
1727template <>
1728struct ReferenceHandler<cl_kernel>
1729{
1730 static cl_int retain(cl_kernel kernel)
1731 { return ::clRetainKernel(kernel); }
1732 static cl_int release(cl_kernel kernel)
1733 { return ::clReleaseKernel(kernel); }
1734};
1735
1736template <>
1737struct ReferenceHandler<cl_event>
1738{
1739 static cl_int retain(cl_event event)
1740 { return ::clRetainEvent(event); }
1741 static cl_int release(cl_event event)
1742 { return ::clReleaseEvent(event); }
1743};
1744
1745
1746#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1747// Extracts version number with major in the upper 16 bits, minor in the lower 16
1748static cl_uint getVersion(const vector<char> &versionInfo)
1749{
1750 int highVersion = 0;
1751 int lowVersion = 0;
1752 int index = 7;
1753 while(versionInfo[index] != '.' ) {
1754 highVersion *= 10;
1755 highVersion += versionInfo[index]-'0';
1756 ++index;
1757 }
1758 ++index;
1759 while(versionInfo[index] != ' ' && versionInfo[index] != '\0') {
1760 lowVersion *= 10;
1761 lowVersion += versionInfo[index]-'0';
1762 ++index;
1763 }
1764 return (highVersion << 16) | lowVersion;
1765}
1766
1767static cl_uint getPlatformVersion(cl_platform_id platform)
1768{
1769 size_type size = 0;
1770 clGetPlatformInfo(platform, CL_PLATFORM_VERSION, 0, NULL, &size);
1771
1772 vector<char> versionInfo(size);
1773 clGetPlatformInfo(platform, CL_PLATFORM_VERSION, size, versionInfo.data(), &size);
1774 return getVersion(versionInfo);
1775}
1776
1777static cl_uint getDevicePlatformVersion(cl_device_id device)
1778{
1779 cl_platform_id platform;
1780 clGetDeviceInfo(device, CL_DEVICE_PLATFORM, sizeof(platform), &platform, NULL);
1781 return getPlatformVersion(platform);
1782}
1783
1784static cl_uint getContextPlatformVersion(cl_context context)
1785{
1786 // The platform cannot be queried directly, so we first have to grab a
1787 // device and obtain its context
1788 size_type size = 0;
1789 clGetContextInfo(context, CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, 0, NULL, &size);
1790 if (size == 0)
1791 return 0;
1792 vector<cl_device_id> devices(size/sizeof(cl_device_id));
1793 clGetContextInfo(context, CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES, size, devices.data(), NULL);
1794 return getDevicePlatformVersion(devices[0]);
1795}
1796#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120 && CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1797
1798template <typename T>
1799class Wrapper
1800{
1801public:
1802 typedef T cl_type;
1803
1804protected:
1805 cl_type object_;
1806
1807public:
1808 Wrapper() : object_(NULL) { }
1809
1810 Wrapper(const cl_type &obj, bool retainObject) : object_(obj)
1811 {
1812 if (retainObject) {
1813 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1814 }
1815 }
1816
1817 ~Wrapper()
1818 {
1819 if (object_ != NULL) { release(); }
1820 }
1821
1822 Wrapper(const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
1823 {
1824 object_ = rhs.object_;
1825 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1826 }
1827
1828 Wrapper(Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
1829 {
1830 object_ = rhs.object_;
1831 rhs.object_ = NULL;
1832 }
1833
1834 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
1835 {
1836 if (this != &rhs) {
1837 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1838 object_ = rhs.object_;
1839 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1840 }
1841 return *this;
1842 }
1843
1844 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs)
1845 {
1846 if (this != &rhs) {
1847 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1848 object_ = rhs.object_;
1849 rhs.object_ = NULL;
1850 }
1851 return *this;
1852 }
1853
1854 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const cl_type &rhs)
1855 {
1856 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1857 object_ = rhs;
1858 return *this;
1859 }
1860
1861 const cl_type& operator ()() const { return object_; }
1862
1863 cl_type& operator ()() { return object_; }
1864
1865 cl_type get() const { return object_; }
1866
1867protected:
1868 template<typename Func, typename U>
1869 friend inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func, cl_uint, U*, int, typename U::cl_type);
1870
1871 cl_int retain() const
1872 {
1873 if (object_ != nullptr) {
1874 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::retain(object_);
1875 }
1876 else {
1877 return CL_SUCCESS;
1878 }
1879 }
1880
1881 cl_int release() const
1882 {
1883 if (object_ != nullptr) {
1884 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::release(object_);
1885 }
1886 else {
1887 return CL_SUCCESS;
1888 }
1889 }
1890};
1891
1892template <>
1893class Wrapper<cl_device_id>
1894{
1895public:
1896 typedef cl_device_id cl_type;
1897
1898protected:
1899 cl_type object_;
1900 bool referenceCountable_;
1901
1902 static bool isReferenceCountable(cl_device_id device)
1903 {
1904 bool retVal = false;
1905#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1906#if CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1907 if (device != NULL) {
1908 int version = getDevicePlatformVersion(device);
1909 if(version > ((1 << 16) + 1)) {
1910 retVal = true;
1911 }
1912 }
1913#else // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1914 retVal = true;
1915#endif // CL_HPP_MINIMUM_OPENCL_VERSION < 120
1916#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
1917 return retVal;
1918 }
1919
1920public:
1921 Wrapper() : object_(NULL), referenceCountable_(false)
1922 {
1923 }
1924
1925 Wrapper(const cl_type &obj, bool retainObject) :
1926 object_(obj),
1927 referenceCountable_(false)
1928 {
1929 referenceCountable_ = isReferenceCountable(obj);
1930
1931 if (retainObject) {
1932 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1933 }
1934 }
1935
1936 ~Wrapper()
1937 {
1938 release();
1939 }
1940
1941 Wrapper(const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
1942 {
1943 object_ = rhs.object_;
1944 referenceCountable_ = isReferenceCountable(object_);
1945 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1946 }
1947
1948 Wrapper(Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
1949 {
1950 object_ = rhs.object_;
1951 referenceCountable_ = rhs.referenceCountable_;
1952 rhs.object_ = NULL;
1953 rhs.referenceCountable_ = false;
1954 }
1955
1956 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const Wrapper<cl_type>& rhs)
1957 {
1958 if (this != &rhs) {
1959 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1960 object_ = rhs.object_;
1961 referenceCountable_ = rhs.referenceCountable_;
1962 detail::errHandler(retain(), __RETAIN_ERR);
1963 }
1964 return *this;
1965 }
1966
1967 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (Wrapper<cl_type>&& rhs)
1968 {
1969 if (this != &rhs) {
1970 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1971 object_ = rhs.object_;
1972 referenceCountable_ = rhs.referenceCountable_;
1973 rhs.object_ = NULL;
1974 rhs.referenceCountable_ = false;
1975 }
1976 return *this;
1977 }
1978
1979 Wrapper<cl_type>& operator = (const cl_type &rhs)
1980 {
1981 detail::errHandler(release(), __RELEASE_ERR);
1982 object_ = rhs;
1983 referenceCountable_ = isReferenceCountable(object_);
1984 return *this;
1985 }
1986
1987 const cl_type& operator ()() const { return object_; }
1988
1989 cl_type& operator ()() { return object_; }
1990
1991 cl_type get() const { return object_; }
1992
1993protected:
1994 template<typename Func, typename U>
1995 friend inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func, cl_uint, U*, int, typename U::cl_type);
1996
1997 template<typename Func, typename U>
1998 friend inline cl_int getInfoHelper(Func, cl_uint, vector<U>*, int, typename U::cl_type);
1999
2000 cl_int retain() const
2001 {
2002 if( object_ != nullptr && referenceCountable_ ) {
2003 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::retain(object_);
2004 }
2005 else {
2006 return CL_SUCCESS;
2007 }
2008 }
2009
2010 cl_int release() const
2011 {
2012 if (object_ != nullptr && referenceCountable_) {
2013 return ReferenceHandler<cl_type>::release(object_);
2014 }
2015 else {
2016 return CL_SUCCESS;
2017 }
2018 }
2019};
2020
2021template <typename T>
2022inline bool operator==(const Wrapper<T> &lhs, const Wrapper<T> &rhs)
2023{
2024 return lhs() == rhs();
2025}
2026
2027template <typename T>
2028inline bool operator!=(const Wrapper<T> &lhs, const Wrapper<T> &rhs)
2029{
2030 return !operator==(lhs, rhs);
2031}
2032
2033} // namespace detail
2035
2036
2037using BuildLogType = vector<std::pair<cl::Device, typename detail::param_traits<detail::cl_program_build_info, CL_PROGRAM_BUILD_LOG>::param_type>>;
2038#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2042class BuildError : public Error
2043{
2044private:
2045 BuildLogType buildLogs;
2046public:
2047 BuildError(cl_int err, const char * errStr, const BuildLogType &vec) : Error(err, errStr), buildLogs(vec)
2048 {
2049 }
2050
2051 BuildLogType getBuildLog() const
2052 {
2053 return buildLogs;
2054 }
2055};
2056namespace detail {
2057 static inline cl_int buildErrHandler(
2058 cl_int err,
2059 const char * errStr,
2060 const BuildLogType &buildLogs)
2061 {
2062 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2063 throw BuildError(err, errStr, buildLogs);
2064 }
2065 return err;
2066 }
2067} // namespace detail
2068
2069#else
2070namespace detail {
2071 static inline cl_int buildErrHandler(
2072 cl_int err,
2073 const char * errStr,
2074 const BuildLogType &buildLogs)
2075 {
2076 (void)buildLogs; // suppress unused variable warning
2077 (void)errStr;
2078 return err;
2079 }
2080} // namespace detail
2081#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2082
2083
2089struct ImageFormat : public cl_image_format
2090{
2092 ImageFormat(){}
2093
2095 ImageFormat(cl_channel_order order, cl_channel_type type)
2096 {
2097 image_channel_order = order;
2098 image_channel_data_type = type;
2099 }
2100
2102 ImageFormat& operator = (const ImageFormat& rhs)
2103 {
2104 if (this != &rhs) {
2105 this->image_channel_data_type = rhs.image_channel_data_type;
2106 this->image_channel_order = rhs.image_channel_order;
2107 }
2108 return *this;
2109 }
2110};
2111
2119class Device : public detail::Wrapper<cl_device_id>
2120{
2121private:
2122 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
2123 static Device default_;
2124 static cl_int default_error_;
2125
2131 static void makeDefault();
2132
2138 static void makeDefaultProvided(const Device &p) {
2139 default_ = p;
2140 }
2141
2142public:
2143#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2150 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
2151 default_ = Device();
2152 }
2153#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2154
2156 Device() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
2157
2162 explicit Device(const cl_device_id &device, bool retainObject = false) :
2163 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(device, retainObject) { }
2164
2169 static Device getDefault(
2170 cl_int *errResult = NULL)
2171 {
2172 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
2173 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2174 if (errResult != NULL) {
2175 *errResult = default_error_;
2176 }
2177 return default_;
2178 }
2179
2187 static Device setDefault(const Device &default_device)
2188 {
2189 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_device));
2190 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2191 return default_;
2192 }
2193
2198 Device& operator = (const cl_device_id& rhs)
2199 {
2200 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
2201 return *this;
2202 }
2203
2207 Device(const Device& dev) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(dev) {}
2208
2212 Device& operator = (const Device &dev)
2213 {
2214 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(dev);
2215 return *this;
2216 }
2217
2221 Device(Device&& dev) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(dev)) {}
2222
2226 Device& operator = (Device &&dev)
2227 {
2228 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(dev));
2229 return *this;
2230 }
2231
2233 template <typename T>
2234 cl_int getInfo(cl_device_info name, T* param) const
2235 {
2236 return detail::errHandler(
2237 detail::getInfo(&::clGetDeviceInfo, object_, name, param),
2238 __GET_DEVICE_INFO_ERR);
2239 }
2240
2242 template <cl_device_info name> typename
2243 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_device_info, name>::param_type
2244 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
2245 {
2246 typename detail::param_traits<
2247 detail::cl_device_info, name>::param_type param;
2248 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
2249 if (err != NULL) {
2250 *err = result;
2251 }
2252 return param;
2253 }
2254
2255
2256#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
2263 cl_ulong getHostTimer(cl_int *error = nullptr)
2264 {
2265 cl_ulong retVal = 0;
2266 cl_int err =
2267 clGetHostTimer(this->get(), &retVal);
2268 detail::errHandler(
2269 err,
2270 __GET_HOST_TIMER_ERR);
2271 if (error) {
2272 *error = err;
2273 }
2274 return retVal;
2275 }
2276
2287 std::pair<cl_ulong, cl_ulong> getDeviceAndHostTimer(cl_int *error = nullptr)
2288 {
2289 std::pair<cl_ulong, cl_ulong> retVal;
2290 cl_int err =
2291 clGetDeviceAndHostTimer(this->get(), &(retVal.first), &(retVal.second));
2292 detail::errHandler(
2293 err,
2294 __GET_DEVICE_AND_HOST_TIMER_ERR);
2295 if (error) {
2296 *error = err;
2297 }
2298 return retVal;
2299 }
2300#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 210
2301
2305#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2307 cl_int createSubDevices(
2308 const cl_device_partition_property * properties,
2309 vector<Device>* devices)
2310 {
2311 cl_uint n = 0;
2312 cl_int err = clCreateSubDevices(object_, properties, 0, NULL, &n);
2313 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2314 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2315 }
2316
2317 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2318 err = clCreateSubDevices(object_, properties, n, ids.data(), NULL);
2319 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2320 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2321 }
2322
2323 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2324 // with safe construction
2325 if (devices) {
2326 devices->resize(ids.size());
2327
2328 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2329 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2330 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2331 // We do not need to retain because this device is being created
2332 // by the runtime
2333 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], false);
2334 }
2335 }
2336
2337 return CL_SUCCESS;
2338 }
2339#elif defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION)
2340
2344 cl_int createSubDevices(
2345 const cl_device_partition_property_ext * properties,
2346 vector<Device>* devices)
2347 {
2348 typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_int
2349 ( CL_API_CALL * PFN_clCreateSubDevicesEXT)(
2350 cl_device_id /*in_device*/,
2351 const cl_device_partition_property_ext * /* properties */,
2352 cl_uint /*num_entries*/,
2353 cl_device_id * /*out_devices*/,
2354 cl_uint * /*num_devices*/ ) CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1;
2355
2356 static PFN_clCreateSubDevicesEXT pfn_clCreateSubDevicesEXT = NULL;
2357 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clCreateSubDevicesEXT);
2358
2359 cl_uint n = 0;
2360 cl_int err = pfn_clCreateSubDevicesEXT(object_, properties, 0, NULL, &n);
2361 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2362 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2363 }
2364
2365 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2366 err = pfn_clCreateSubDevicesEXT(object_, properties, n, ids.data(), NULL);
2367 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2368 return detail::errHandler(err, __CREATE_SUB_DEVICES_ERR);
2369 }
2370 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2371 // with safe construction
2372 if (devices) {
2373 devices->resize(ids.size());
2374
2375 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2376 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2377 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2378 // We do not need to retain because this device is being created
2379 // by the runtime
2380 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], false);
2381 }
2382 }
2383 return CL_SUCCESS;
2384 }
2385#endif // defined(CL_HPP_USE_CL_DEVICE_FISSION)
2386};
2387
2388CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag Device::default_initialized_;
2389CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ Device Device::default_;
2390CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int Device::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
2391
2399class Platform : public detail::Wrapper<cl_platform_id>
2400{
2401private:
2402 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
2403 static Platform default_;
2404 static cl_int default_error_;
2405
2411 static void makeDefault() {
2412 /* Throwing an exception from a call_once invocation does not do
2413 * what we wish, so we catch it and save the error.
2414 */
2415#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2416 try
2417#endif
2418 {
2419 // If default wasn't passed ,generate one
2420 // Otherwise set it
2421 cl_uint n = 0;
2422
2423 cl_int err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(0, NULL, &n);
2424 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2425 default_error_ = err;
2426 return;
2427 }
2428 if (n == 0) {
2429 default_error_ = CL_INVALID_PLATFORM;
2430 return;
2431 }
2432
2433 vector<cl_platform_id> ids(n);
2434 err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(n, ids.data(), NULL);
2435 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2436 default_error_ = err;
2437 return;
2438 }
2439
2440 default_ = Platform(ids[0]);
2441 }
2442#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2443 catch (cl::Error &e) {
2444 default_error_ = e.err();
2445 }
2446#endif
2447 }
2448
2454 static void makeDefaultProvided(const Platform &p) {
2455 default_ = p;
2456 }
2457
2458public:
2459#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2466 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
2467 default_ = Platform();
2468 }
2469#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2470
2472 Platform() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
2473
2481 explicit Platform(const cl_platform_id &platform, bool retainObject = false) :
2482 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(platform, retainObject) { }
2483
2488 Platform& operator = (const cl_platform_id& rhs)
2489 {
2490 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
2491 return *this;
2492 }
2493
2494 static Platform getDefault(
2495 cl_int *errResult = NULL)
2496 {
2497 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
2498 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2499 if (errResult != NULL) {
2500 *errResult = default_error_;
2501 }
2502 return default_;
2503 }
2504
2512 static Platform setDefault(const Platform &default_platform)
2513 {
2514 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_platform));
2515 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
2516 return default_;
2517 }
2518
2520 template <typename T>
2521 cl_int getInfo(cl_platform_info name, T* param) const
2522 {
2523 return detail::errHandler(
2524 detail::getInfo(&::clGetPlatformInfo, object_, name, param),
2525 __GET_PLATFORM_INFO_ERR);
2526 }
2527
2529 template <cl_platform_info name> typename
2530 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_platform_info, name>::param_type
2531 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
2532 {
2533 typename detail::param_traits<
2534 detail::cl_platform_info, name>::param_type param;
2535 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
2536 if (err != NULL) {
2537 *err = result;
2538 }
2539 return param;
2540 }
2541
2546 cl_int getDevices(
2547 cl_device_type type,
2548 vector<Device>* devices) const
2549 {
2550 cl_uint n = 0;
2551 if( devices == NULL ) {
2552 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2553 }
2554 cl_int err = ::clGetDeviceIDs(object_, type, 0, NULL, &n);
2555 if (err != CL_SUCCESS && err != CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND) {
2556 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2557 }
2558
2559 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2560 if (n>0) {
2561 err = ::clGetDeviceIDs(object_, type, n, ids.data(), NULL);
2562 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2563 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2564 }
2565 }
2566
2567 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2568 // with safe construction
2569 // We must retain things we obtain from the API to avoid releasing
2570 // API-owned objects.
2571 if (devices) {
2572 devices->resize(ids.size());
2573
2574 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2575 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2576 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2577 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], true);
2578 }
2579 }
2580 return CL_SUCCESS;
2581 }
2582
2583#if defined(CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP)
2607 cl_int getDevices(
2608 cl_d3d10_device_source_khr d3d_device_source,
2609 void * d3d_object,
2610 cl_d3d10_device_set_khr d3d_device_set,
2611 vector<Device>* devices) const
2612 {
2613 typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_int (CL_API_CALL *PFN_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR)(
2614 cl_platform_id platform,
2615 cl_d3d10_device_source_khr d3d_device_source,
2616 void * d3d_object,
2617 cl_d3d10_device_set_khr d3d_device_set,
2618 cl_uint num_entries,
2619 cl_device_id * devices,
2620 cl_uint* num_devices);
2621
2622 if( devices == NULL ) {
2623 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2624 }
2625
2626 static PFN_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR pfn_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR = NULL;
2627 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(object_, clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR);
2628
2629 cl_uint n = 0;
2630 cl_int err = pfn_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR(
2631 object_,
2632 d3d_device_source,
2633 d3d_object,
2634 d3d_device_set,
2635 0,
2636 NULL,
2637 &n);
2638 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2639 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2640 }
2641
2642 vector<cl_device_id> ids(n);
2643 err = pfn_clGetDeviceIDsFromD3D10KHR(
2644 object_,
2645 d3d_device_source,
2646 d3d_object,
2647 d3d_device_set,
2648 n,
2649 ids.data(),
2650 NULL);
2651 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2652 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_DEVICE_IDS_ERR);
2653 }
2654
2655 // Cannot trivially assign because we need to capture intermediates
2656 // with safe construction
2657 // We must retain things we obtain from the API to avoid releasing
2658 // API-owned objects.
2659 if (devices) {
2660 devices->resize(ids.size());
2661
2662 // Assign to param, constructing with retain behaviour
2663 // to correctly capture each underlying CL object
2664 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2665 (*devices)[i] = Device(ids[i], true);
2666 }
2667 }
2668 return CL_SUCCESS;
2669 }
2670#endif
2671
2676 static cl_int get(
2677 vector<Platform>* platforms)
2678 {
2679 cl_uint n = 0;
2680
2681 if( platforms == NULL ) {
2682 return detail::errHandler(CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE, __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR);
2683 }
2684
2685 cl_int err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(0, NULL, &n);
2686 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2687 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR);
2688 }
2689
2690 vector<cl_platform_id> ids(n);
2691 err = ::clGetPlatformIDs(n, ids.data(), NULL);
2692 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
2693 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_PLATFORM_IDS_ERR);
2694 }
2695
2696 if (platforms) {
2697 platforms->resize(ids.size());
2698
2699 // Platforms don't reference count
2700 for (size_type i = 0; i < ids.size(); i++) {
2701 (*platforms)[i] = Platform(ids[i]);
2702 }
2703 }
2704 return CL_SUCCESS;
2705 }
2706
2711 static cl_int get(
2712 Platform * platform)
2713 {
2714 cl_int err;
2715 Platform default_platform = Platform::getDefault(&err);
2716 if (platform) {
2717 *platform = default_platform;
2718 }
2719 return err;
2720 }
2721
2730 static Platform get(
2731 cl_int * errResult = NULL)
2732 {
2733 cl_int err;
2734 Platform default_platform = Platform::getDefault(&err);
2735 if (errResult) {
2736 *errResult = err;
2737 }
2738 return default_platform;
2739 }
2740
2741#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2743 cl_int
2744 unloadCompiler()
2745 {
2746 return ::clUnloadPlatformCompiler(object_);
2747 }
2748#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
2749}; // class Platform
2750
2751CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag Platform::default_initialized_;
2752CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ Platform Platform::default_;
2753CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int Platform::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
2754
2755
2759#if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
2764inline CL_EXT_PREFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED cl_int
2765UnloadCompiler() CL_EXT_SUFFIX__VERSION_1_1_DEPRECATED;
2766inline cl_int
2767UnloadCompiler()
2768{
2769 return ::clUnloadCompiler();
2770}
2771#endif // #if defined(CL_USE_DEPRECATED_OPENCL_1_1_APIS)
2772
2781class Context
2782 : public detail::Wrapper<cl_context>
2783{
2784private:
2785 static std::once_flag default_initialized_;
2786 static Context default_;
2787 static cl_int default_error_;
2788
2794 static void makeDefault() {
2795 /* Throwing an exception from a call_once invocation does not do
2796 * what we wish, so we catch it and save the error.
2797 */
2798#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2799 try
2800#endif
2801 {
2802#if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
2803 const Platform &p = Platform::getDefault();
2804 cl_platform_id defaultPlatform = p();
2805 cl_context_properties properties[3] = {
2806 CL_CONTEXT_PLATFORM, (cl_context_properties)defaultPlatform, 0
2807 };
2808#else // #if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
2809 cl_context_properties *properties = nullptr;
2810#endif // #if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
2811
2812 default_ = Context(
2813 CL_DEVICE_TYPE_DEFAULT,
2814 properties,
2815 NULL,
2816 NULL,
2817 &default_error_);
2818 }
2819#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2820 catch (cl::Error &e) {
2821 default_error_ = e.err();
2822 }
2823#endif
2824 }
2825
2826
2832 static void makeDefaultProvided(const Context &c) {
2833 default_ = c;
2834 }
2835
2836public:
2837#ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2844 static void unitTestClearDefault() {
2845 default_ = Context();
2846 }
2847#endif // #ifdef CL_HPP_UNIT_TEST_ENABLE
2848
2853 Context(
2854 const vector<Device>& devices,
2855 cl_context_properties* properties = NULL,
2856 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(
2857 const char *,
2858 const void *,
2859 size_type,
2860 void *) = NULL,
2861 void* data = NULL,
2862 cl_int* err = NULL)
2863 {
2864 cl_int error;
2865
2866 size_type numDevices = devices.size();
2867 vector<cl_device_id> deviceIDs(numDevices);
2868
2869 for( size_type deviceIndex = 0; deviceIndex < numDevices; ++deviceIndex ) {
2870 deviceIDs[deviceIndex] = (devices[deviceIndex])();
2871 }
2872
2873 object_ = ::clCreateContext(
2874 properties, (cl_uint) numDevices,
2875 deviceIDs.data(),
2876 notifyFptr, data, &error);
2877
2878 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
2879 if (err != NULL) {
2880 *err = error;
2881 }
2882 }
2883
2888 Context(
2889 const Device& device,
2890 cl_context_properties* properties = NULL,
2891 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(
2892 const char *,
2893 const void *,
2894 size_type,
2895 void *) = NULL,
2896 void* data = NULL,
2897 cl_int* err = NULL)
2898 {
2899 cl_int error;
2900
2901 cl_device_id deviceID = device();
2902
2903 object_ = ::clCreateContext(
2904 properties, 1,
2905 &deviceID,
2906 notifyFptr, data, &error);
2907
2908 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
2909 if (err != NULL) {
2910 *err = error;
2911 }
2912 }
2913
2918 Context(
2919 cl_device_type type,
2920 cl_context_properties* properties = NULL,
2921 void (CL_CALLBACK * notifyFptr)(
2922 const char *,
2923 const void *,
2924 size_type,
2925 void *) = NULL,
2926 void* data = NULL,
2927 cl_int* err = NULL)
2928 {
2929 cl_int error;
2930
2931#if !defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__MACOS)
2932 cl_context_properties prop[4] = {CL_CONTEXT_PLATFORM, 0, 0, 0 };
2933
2934 if (properties == NULL) {
2935 // Get a valid platform ID as we cannot send in a blank one
2936 vector<Platform> platforms;
2937 error = Platform::get(&platforms);
2938 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
2939 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
2940 if (err != NULL) {
2941 *err = error;
2942 }
2943 return;
2944 }
2945
2946 // Check the platforms we found for a device of our specified type
2947 cl_context_properties platform_id = 0;
2948 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < platforms.size(); i++) {
2949
2950 vector<Device> devices;
2951
2952#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2953 try {
2954#endif
2955
2956 error = platforms[i].getDevices(type, &devices);
2957
2958#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
2959 } catch (cl::Error& e) {
2960 error = e.err();
2961 }
2962 // Catch if exceptions are enabled as we don't want to exit if first platform has no devices of type
2963 // We do error checking next anyway, and can throw there if needed
2964#endif
2965
2966 // Only squash CL_SUCCESS and CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND
2967 if (error != CL_SUCCESS && error != CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND) {
2968 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
2969 if (err != NULL) {
2970 *err = error;
2971 }
2972 }
2973
2974 if (devices.size() > 0) {
2975 platform_id = (cl_context_properties)platforms[i]();
2976 break;
2977 }
2978 }
2979
2980 if (platform_id == 0) {
2981 detail::errHandler(CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
2982 if (err != NULL) {
2983 *err = CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND;
2984 }
2985 return;
2986 }
2987
2988 prop[1] = platform_id;
2989 properties = &prop[0];
2990 }
2991#endif
2992 object_ = ::clCreateContextFromType(
2993 properties, type, notifyFptr, data, &error);
2994
2995 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_FROM_TYPE_ERR);
2996 if (err != NULL) {
2997 *err = error;
2998 }
2999 }
3000
3004 Context(const Context& ctx) : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(ctx) {}
3005
3009 Context& operator = (const Context &ctx)
3010 {
3011 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(ctx);
3012 return *this;
3013 }
3014
3018 Context(Context&& ctx) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(std::move(ctx)) {}
3019
3023 Context& operator = (Context &&ctx)
3024 {
3025 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(std::move(ctx));
3026 return *this;
3027 }
3028
3029
3034 static Context getDefault(cl_int * err = NULL)
3035 {
3036 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefault);
3037 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
3038 if (err != NULL) {
3039 *err = default_error_;
3040 }
3041 return default_;
3042 }
3043
3051 static Context setDefault(const Context &default_context)
3052 {
3053 std::call_once(default_initialized_, makeDefaultProvided, std::cref(default_context));
3054 detail::errHandler(default_error_);
3055 return default_;
3056 }
3057
3059 Context() : detail::Wrapper<cl_type>() { }
3060
3066 explicit Context(const cl_context& context, bool retainObject = false) :
3067 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(context, retainObject) { }
3068
3074 Context& operator = (const cl_context& rhs)
3075 {
3076 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
3077 return *this;
3078 }
3079
3081 template <typename T>
3082 cl_int getInfo(cl_context_info name, T* param) const
3083 {
3084 return detail::errHandler(
3085 detail::getInfo(&::clGetContextInfo, object_, name, param),
3086 __GET_CONTEXT_INFO_ERR);
3087 }
3088
3090 template <cl_context_info name> typename
3091 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_context_info, name>::param_type
3092 getInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
3093 {
3094 typename detail::param_traits<
3095 detail::cl_context_info, name>::param_type param;
3096 cl_int result = getInfo(name, &param);
3097 if (err != NULL) {
3098 *err = result;
3099 }
3100 return param;
3101 }
3102
3107 cl_int getSupportedImageFormats(
3108 cl_mem_flags flags,
3109 cl_mem_object_type type,
3110 vector<ImageFormat>* formats) const
3111 {
3112 cl_uint numEntries;
3113
3114 if (!formats) {
3115 return CL_SUCCESS;
3116 }
3117
3118 cl_int err = ::clGetSupportedImageFormats(
3119 object_,
3120 flags,
3121 type,
3122 0,
3123 NULL,
3124 &numEntries);
3125 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
3126 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_SUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMATS_ERR);
3127 }
3128
3129 if (numEntries > 0) {
3130 vector<ImageFormat> value(numEntries);
3131 err = ::clGetSupportedImageFormats(
3132 object_,
3133 flags,
3134 type,
3135 numEntries,
3136 (cl_image_format*)value.data(),
3137 NULL);
3138 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
3139 return detail::errHandler(err, __GET_SUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMATS_ERR);
3140 }
3141
3142 formats->assign(begin(value), end(value));
3143 }
3144 else {
3145 // If no values are being returned, ensure an empty vector comes back
3146 formats->clear();
3147 }
3148
3149 return CL_SUCCESS;
3150 }
3151};
3152
3153inline void Device::makeDefault()
3154{
3155 /* Throwing an exception from a call_once invocation does not do
3156 * what we wish, so we catch it and save the error.
3157 */
3158#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3159 try
3160#endif
3161 {
3162 cl_int error = 0;
3163
3164 Context context = Context::getDefault(&error);
3165 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_CONTEXT_ERR);
3166
3167 if (error != CL_SUCCESS) {
3168 default_error_ = error;
3169 }
3170 else {
3171 default_ = context.getInfo<CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES>()[0];
3172 default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
3173 }
3174 }
3175#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3176 catch (cl::Error &e) {
3177 default_error_ = e.err();
3178 }
3179#endif
3180}
3181
3182CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ std::once_flag Context::default_initialized_;
3183CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ Context Context::default_;
3184CL_HPP_DEFINE_STATIC_MEMBER_ cl_int Context::default_error_ = CL_SUCCESS;
3185

3209 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>(event, retainObject) { }
3210
3216 Event& operator = (const cl_event& rhs)
3217 {
3218 detail::Wrapper<cl_type>::operator=(rhs);
3219 return *this;
3220 }

3227 detail::getInfo(&::clGetEventInfo, object_, name, param),
3228 __GET_EVENT_INFO_ERR);

3250 &::clGetEventProfilingInfo, object_, name, param),

3260 detail::cl_profiling_info, name>::param_type param;

3262 if (err != NULL) {

3267
3272 cl_int wait() const
3273 {
3274 return detail::errHandler(
3275 ::clWaitForEvents(1, &object_),
3276 __WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR);
3277 }

3303 static cl_int
3304 waitForEvents(const vector<Event>& events)
3305 {

3307 ::clWaitForEvents(
3308 (cl_uint) events.size(), (events.size() > 0) ? (cl_event*)&events.front() : NULL),
3309 __WAIT_FOR_EVENTS_ERR);
3310 }

3489// Pre-declare copy functions
3490class Buffer;
3491template< typename IteratorType >
3492cl_int copy( IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator, cl::Buffer &buffer );
3493template< typename IteratorType >
3494cl_int copy( const cl::Buffer &buffer, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator );

3496cl_int copy( const CommandQueue &queue, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator, cl::Buffer &buffer );

3500
3501#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
3502namespace detail
3503{
3504 class SVMTraitNull
3505 {
3506 public:
3507 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3508 {
3509 return 0;
3510 }
3511 };
3512} // namespace detail
3513
3514template<class Trait = detail::SVMTraitNull>
3515class SVMTraitReadWrite
3516{
3517public:
3518 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3519 {
3520 return CL_MEM_READ_WRITE |
3521 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3522 }
3523};
3524
3525template<class Trait = detail::SVMTraitNull>
3526class SVMTraitReadOnly
3527{
3528public:
3529 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3530 {
3531 return CL_MEM_READ_ONLY |
3532 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3533 }
3534};
3535
3536template<class Trait = detail::SVMTraitNull>
3537class SVMTraitWriteOnly
3538{
3539public:
3540 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3541 {
3542 return CL_MEM_WRITE_ONLY |
3543 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3544 }
3545};
3546
3547template<class Trait = SVMTraitReadWrite<>>
3548class SVMTraitCoarse
3549{
3550public:
3551 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3552 {
3553 return Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3554 }
3555};
3556
3557template<class Trait = SVMTraitReadWrite<>>
3558class SVMTraitFine
3559{
3560public:
3561 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3562 {
3563 return CL_MEM_SVM_FINE_GRAIN_BUFFER |
3564 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3565 }
3566};
3567
3568template<class Trait = SVMTraitReadWrite<>>
3569class SVMTraitAtomic
3570{
3571public:
3572 static cl_svm_mem_flags getSVMMemFlags()
3573 {
3574 return
3575 CL_MEM_SVM_FINE_GRAIN_BUFFER |
3576 CL_MEM_SVM_ATOMICS |
3577 Trait::getSVMMemFlags();
3578 }
3579};
3580
3581// Pre-declare SVM map function
3582template<typename T>
3583inline cl_int enqueueMapSVM(
3584 T* ptr,
3585 cl_bool blocking,
3586 cl_map_flags flags,
3587 size_type size,
3588 const vector<Event>* events = NULL,
3589 Event* event = NULL);
3590
3602template<typename T, class SVMTrait>
3603class SVMAllocator {
3604private:
3605 Context context_;
3606
3607public:
3608 typedef T value_type;
3609 typedef value_type* pointer;
3610 typedef const value_type* const_pointer;
3611 typedef value_type& reference;
3612 typedef const value_type& const_reference;
3613 typedef std::size_t size_type;
3614 typedef std::ptrdiff_t difference_type;
3615
3616 template<typename U>
3617 struct rebind
3618 {
3619 typedef SVMAllocator<U, SVMTrait> other;
3620 };
3621
3622 template<typename U, typename V>
3623 friend class SVMAllocator;
3624
3625 SVMAllocator() :
3626 context_(Context::getDefault())
3627 {
3628 }
3629
3630 explicit SVMAllocator(cl::Context context) :
3631 context_(context)
3632 {
3633 }
3634
3635
3636 SVMAllocator(const SVMAllocator &other) :
3637 context_(other.context_)
3638 {
3639 }
3640
3641 template<typename U>
3642 SVMAllocator(const SVMAllocator<U, SVMTrait> &other) :
3643 context_(other.context_)
3644 {
3645 }
3646
3647 ~SVMAllocator()
3648 {
3649 }
3650
3651 pointer address(reference r) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
3652 {
3653 return std::addressof(r);
3654 }
3655
3656 const_pointer address(const_reference r) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
3657 {
3658 return std::addressof(r);
3659 }
3660
3667 pointer allocate(
3668 size_type size,
3669 typename cl::SVMAllocator<void, SVMTrait>::const_pointer = 0)
3670 {
3671 // Allocate memory with default alignment matching the size of the type
3672 void* voidPointer =
3673 clSVMAlloc(
3674 context_(),
3675 SVMTrait::getSVMMemFlags(),
3676 size*sizeof(T),
3677 0);
3678 pointer retValue = reinterpret_cast<pointer>(
3679 voidPointer);
3680#if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3681 if (!retValue) {
3682 std::bad_alloc excep;
3683 throw excep;
3684 }
3685#endif // #if defined(CL_HPP_ENABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
3686
3687 // If allocation was coarse-grained then map it
3688 if (!(SVMTrait::getSVMMemFlags() & CL_MEM_SVM_FINE_GRAIN_BUFFER)) {
3689 cl_int err = enqueueMapSVM(retValue, CL_TRUE, CL_MAP_READ | CL_MAP_WRITE, size*sizeof(T));
3690 if (err != CL_SUCCESS) {
3691 std::bad_alloc excep;
3692 throw excep;
3693 }
3694 }
3695
3696 // If exceptions disabled, return null pointer from allocator
3697 return retValue;
3698 }
3699
3700 void deallocate(pointer p, size_type)
3701 {
3702 clSVMFree(context_(), p);
3703 }
3704
3709 size_type max_size() const CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_
3710 {
3711 size_type maxSize = std::numeric_limits<size_type>::max() / sizeof(T);
3712
3713 for (const Device &d : context_.getInfo<CL_CONTEXT_DEVICES>()) {
3714 maxSize = std::min(
3715 maxSize,
3716 static_cast<size_type>(d.getInfo<CL_DEVICE_MAX_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE>()));
3717 }
3718
3719 return maxSize;
3720 }
3721
3722 template< class U, class... Args >
3723 void construct(U* p, Args&&... args)
3724 {
3725 new(p)T(args...);
3726 }
3727
3728 template< class U >
3729 void destroy(U* p)
3730 {
3731 p->~U();
3732 }
3733
3737 inline bool operator==(SVMAllocator const& rhs)
3738 {
3739 return (context_==rhs.context_);
3740 }
3741
3742 inline bool operator!=(SVMAllocator const& a)
3743 {
3744 return !operator==(a);
3745 }
3746}; // class SVMAllocator return cl::pointer<T>(tmp, detail::Deleter<T, Alloc>{alloc, copies});
3747
3748
3749template<class SVMTrait>
3750class SVMAllocator<void, SVMTrait> {
3751public:
3752 typedef void value_type;
3753 typedef value_type* pointer;
3754 typedef const value_type* const_pointer;
3755
3756 template<typename U>
3757 struct rebind
3758 {
3759 typedef SVMAllocator<U, SVMTrait> other;
3760 };
3761
3762 template<typename U, typename V>
3763 friend class SVMAllocator;
3764};
3765
3766#if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_UNIQUE_PTR)
3767namespace detail
3768{
3769 template<class Alloc>
3770 class Deleter {
3771 private:
3772 Alloc alloc_;
3773 size_type copies_;
3774
3775 public:
3776 typedef typename std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::pointer pointer;
3777
3778 Deleter(const Alloc &alloc, size_type copies) : alloc_{ alloc }, copies_{ copies }
3779 {
3780 }
3781
3782 void operator()(pointer ptr) const {
3783 Alloc tmpAlloc{ alloc_ };
3784 std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::destroy(tmpAlloc, std::addressof(*ptr));
3785 std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::deallocate(tmpAlloc, ptr, copies_);
3786 }
3787 };
3788} // namespace detail
3789
3796template <class T, class Alloc, class... Args>
3797cl::pointer<T, detail::Deleter<Alloc>> allocate_pointer(const Alloc &alloc_, Args&&... args)
3798{
3799 Alloc alloc(alloc_);
3800 static const size_type copies = 1;
3801
3802 // Ensure that creation of the management block and the
3803 // object are dealt with separately such that we only provide a deleter
3804
3805 T* tmp = std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::allocate(alloc, copies);
3806 if (!tmp) {
3807 std::bad_alloc excep;
3808 throw excep;
3809 }
3810 try {
3811 std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::construct(
3812 alloc,
3813 std::addressof(*tmp),
3814 std::forward<Args>(args)...);
3815
3816 return cl::pointer<T, detail::Deleter<Alloc>>(tmp, detail::Deleter<Alloc>{alloc, copies});
3817 }
3818 catch (std::bad_alloc& b)
3819 {
3820 std::allocator_traits<Alloc>::deallocate(alloc, tmp, copies);
3821 throw;
3822 }
3823}
3824
3825template< class T, class SVMTrait, class... Args >
3826cl::pointer<T, detail::Deleter<SVMAllocator<T, SVMTrait>>> allocate_svm(Args... args)
3827{
3828 SVMAllocator<T, SVMTrait> alloc;
3829 return cl::allocate_pointer<T>(alloc, args...);
3830}
3831
3832template< class T, class SVMTrait, class... Args >
3833cl::pointer<T, detail::Deleter<SVMAllocator<T, SVMTrait>>> allocate_svm(const cl::Context &c, Args... args)
3834{
3835 SVMAllocator<T, SVMTrait> alloc(c);
3836 return cl::allocate_pointer<T>(alloc, args...);
3837}
3838#endif // #if !defined(CL_HPP_NO_STD_UNIQUE_PTR)
3839
3843template < class T >
3844using coarse_svm_vector = vector<T, cl::SVMAllocator<int, cl::SVMTraitCoarse<>>>;
3845
3849template < class T >
3850using fine_svm_vector = vector<T, cl::SVMAllocator<int, cl::SVMTraitFine<>>>;
3851
3855template < class T >
3856using atomic_svm_vector = vector<T, cl::SVMAllocator<int, cl::SVMTraitAtomic<>>>;
3857
3858#endif // #if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 200
3859
3860
3867class Buffer : public Memory
3868{
3869public:
3870
3878 Buffer(
3879 const Context& context,
3880 cl_mem_flags flags,
3881 size_type size,
3882 void* host_ptr = NULL,
3883 cl_int* err = NULL)
3884 {
3885 cl_int error;
3886 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, host_ptr, &error);
3887
3888 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
3889 if (err != NULL) {
3890 *err = error;
3891 }
3892 }
3893
3903 Buffer(
3904 cl_mem_flags flags,
3905 size_type size,
3906 void* host_ptr = NULL,
3907 cl_int* err = NULL)
3908 {
3909 cl_int error;
3910
3911 Context context = Context::getDefault(err);
3912
3913 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, host_ptr, &error);
3914
3915 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
3916 if (err != NULL) {
3917 *err = error;
3918 }
3919 }
3920
3926 template< typename IteratorType >
3927 Buffer(
3928 IteratorType startIterator,
3929 IteratorType endIterator,
3930 bool readOnly,
3931 bool useHostPtr = false,
3932 cl_int* err = NULL)
3933 {
3934 typedef typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type DataType;
3935 cl_int error;
3936
3937 cl_mem_flags flags = 0;
3938 if( readOnly ) {
3939 flags |= CL_MEM_READ_ONLY;
3940 }
3941 else {
3942 flags |= CL_MEM_READ_WRITE;
3943 }
3944 if( useHostPtr ) {
3945 flags |= CL_MEM_USE_HOST_PTR;
3946 }
3947
3948 size_type size = sizeof(DataType)*(endIterator - startIterator);
3949
3950 Context context = Context::getDefault(err);
3951
3952 if( useHostPtr ) {
3953 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, static_cast<DataType*>(&*startIterator), &error);
3954 } else {
3955 object_ = ::clCreateBuffer(context(), flags, size, 0, &error);
3956 }
3957
3958 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
3959 if (err != NULL) {
3960 *err = error;
3961 }
3962
3963 if( !useHostPtr ) {
3964 error = cl::copy(startIterator, endIterator, *this);
3965 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_BUFFER_ERR);
3966 if (err != NULL) {
3967 *err = error;
3968 }
3969 }
3970 }
3971
3977 template< typename IteratorType >
3978 Buffer(const Context &context, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator,
3979 bool readOnly, bool useHostPtr = false, cl_int* err = NULL);
3980
3985 template< typename IteratorType >
3986 Buffer(const CommandQueue &queue, IteratorType startIterator, IteratorType endIterator,
3987 bool readOnly, bool useHostPtr = false, cl_int* err = NULL);
3988
3990 Buffer() : Memory() { }
3991
3999 explicit Buffer(const cl_mem& buffer, bool retainObject = false) :
4000 Memory(buffer, retainObject) { }
4001
4006 Buffer& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4007 {
4008 Memory::operator=(rhs);
4009 return *this;
4010 }
4011
4015 Buffer(const Buffer& buf) : Memory(buf) {}
4016
4020 Buffer& operator = (const Buffer &buf)
4021 {
4022 Memory::operator=(buf);
4023 return *this;
4024 }
4025
4029 Buffer(Buffer&& buf) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Memory(std::move(buf)) {}
4030
4034 Buffer& operator = (Buffer &&buf)
4035 {
4036 Memory::operator=(std::move(buf));
4037 return *this;
4038 }
4039
4040#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
4045 Buffer createSubBuffer(
4046 cl_mem_flags flags,
4047 cl_buffer_create_type buffer_create_type,
4048 const void * buffer_create_info,
4049 cl_int * err = NULL)
4050 {
4051 Buffer result;
4052 cl_int error;
4053 result.object_ = ::clCreateSubBuffer(
4054 object_,
4055 flags,
4056 buffer_create_type,
4057 buffer_create_info,
4058 &error);
4059
4060 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_SUBBUFFER_ERR);
4061 if (err != NULL) {
4062 *err = error;
4063 }
4064
4065 return result;
4066 }
4067#endif // CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
4068};
4069
4070#if defined (CL_HPP_USE_DX_INTEROP)
4079class BufferD3D10 : public Buffer
4080{
4081public:
4082
4083
4089 BufferD3D10(
4090 const Context& context,
4091 cl_mem_flags flags,
4092 ID3D10Buffer* bufobj,
4093 cl_int * err = NULL) : pfn_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR(nullptr)
4094 {
4095 typedef CL_API_ENTRY cl_mem (CL_API_CALL *PFN_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR)(
4096 cl_context context, cl_mem_flags flags, ID3D10Buffer* buffer,
4097 cl_int* errcode_ret);
4098 PFN_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR pfn_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR;
4099#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
4100 vector<cl_context_properties> props = context.getInfo<CL_CONTEXT_PROPERTIES>();
4101 cl_platform platform = -1;
4102 for( int i = 0; i < props.size(); ++i ) {
4103 if( props[i] == CL_CONTEXT_PLATFORM ) {
4104 platform = props[i+1];
4105 }
4106 }
4107 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_PLATFORM_(platform, clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR);
4108#elif CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 110
4109 CL_HPP_INIT_CL_EXT_FCN_PTR_(clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR);
4110#endif
4111
4112 cl_int error;
4113 object_ = pfn_clCreateFromD3D10BufferKHR(
4114 context(),
4115 flags,
4116 bufobj,
4117 &error);
4118
4119 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_GL_BUFFER_ERR);
4120 if (err != NULL) {
4121 *err = error;
4122 }
4123 }
4124
4126 BufferD3D10() : Buffer() { }
4127
4135 explicit BufferD3D10(const cl_mem& buffer, bool retainObject = false) :
4136 Buffer(buffer, retainObject) { }
4137
4142 BufferD3D10& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4143 {
4144 Buffer::operator=(rhs);
4145 return *this;
4146 }
4147
4151 BufferD3D10(const BufferD3D10& buf) :
4152 Buffer(buf) {}
4153
4157 BufferD3D10& operator = (const BufferD3D10 &buf)
4158 {
4159 Buffer::operator=(buf);
4160 return *this;
4161 }
4162
4166 BufferD3D10(BufferD3D10&& buf) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Buffer(std::move(buf)) {}
4167
4171 BufferD3D10& operator = (BufferD3D10 &&buf)
4172 {
4173 Buffer::operator=(std::move(buf));
4174 return *this;
4175 }
4176};
4177#endif
4178
4187class BufferGL : public Buffer
4188{

4196 const Context& context,

4198 cl_GLuint bufobj,
4199 cl_int * err = NULL)
4200 {

4202 object_ = ::clCreateFromGLBuffer(
4203 context(),
4204 flags,
4205 bufobj,
4206 &error);

4210 *err = error;
4211 }

4268 cl_GLuint * gl_object_name)
4269 {

4271 ::clGetGLObjectInfo(object_,type,gl_object_name),

4273 }
4274};

4372
4379class Image : public Memory
4380{
4381protected:
4383 Image() : Memory() { }
4384
4392 explicit Image(const cl_mem& image, bool retainObject = false) :
4393 Memory(image, retainObject) { }
4394
4399 Image& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4400 {
4401 Memory::operator=(rhs);
4402 return *this;
4403 }
4404
4408 Image(const Image& img) : Memory(img) {}
4409
4413 Image& operator = (const Image &img)
4414 {
4415 Memory::operator=(img);
4416 return *this;
4417 }
4418
4422 Image(Image&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Memory(std::move(img)) {}
4423
4427 Image& operator = (Image &&img)
4428 {
4429 Memory::operator=(std::move(img));
4430 return *this;
4431 }
4432
4433
4434public:
4436 template <typename T>
4437 cl_int getImageInfo(cl_image_info name, T* param) const
4438 {
4439 return detail::errHandler(
4440 detail::getInfo(&::clGetImageInfo, object_, name, param),
4441 __GET_IMAGE_INFO_ERR);
4442 }
4443
4445 template <cl_image_info name> typename
4446 detail::param_traits<detail::cl_image_info, name>::param_type
4447 getImageInfo(cl_int* err = NULL) const
4448 {
4449 typename detail::param_traits<
4450 detail::cl_image_info, name>::param_type param;
4451 cl_int result = getImageInfo(name, &param);
4452 if (err != NULL) {
4453 *err = result;
4454 }
4455 return param;
4456 }
4457};
4458
4459#if CL_HPP_TARGET_OPENCL_VERSION >= 120
4466class Image1D : public Image
4467{
4468public:
4473 Image1D(
4474 const Context& context,
4475 cl_mem_flags flags,
4476 ImageFormat format,
4477 size_type width,
4478 void* host_ptr = NULL,
4479 cl_int* err = NULL)
4480 {
4481 cl_int error;
4482 cl_image_desc desc =
4483 {
4484 CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE1D,
4485 width,
4486 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0
4487 };
4488 object_ = ::clCreateImage(
4489 context(),
4490 flags,
4491 &format,
4492 &desc,
4493 host_ptr,
4494 &error);
4495
4496 detail::errHandler(error, __CREATE_IMAGE_ERR);
4497 if (err != NULL) {
4498 *err = error;
4499 }
4500 }
4501
4503 Image1D() { }
4504
4512 explicit Image1D(const cl_mem& image1D, bool retainObject = false) :
4513 Image(image1D, retainObject) { }
4514
4519 Image1D& operator = (const cl_mem& rhs)
4520 {
4521 Image::operator=(rhs);
4522 return *this;
4523 }
4524
4528 Image1D(const Image1D& img) : Image(img) {}
4529
4533 Image1D& operator = (const Image1D &img)
4534 {
4535 Image::operator=(img);
4536 return *this;
4537 }
4538
4542 Image1D(Image1D&& img) CL_HPP_NOEXCEPT_ : Image(std::move(img)) {}
4543

4548 {
4549 Image::operator=(std::move(img));
4550 return *this;
4551 }
4552
4553};
